item.title: Carney Plans to Meet With Xi to Try and Reset Relations
item.description: The leaders of Canada and China met for the first time in eight years to try to reset relations after years of acrimony.

item.title: Exxon’s and Chevron’s Profits Fall as Oil Prices Stay Low
item.description: But the companies and other large oil producers are continuing to increase production because drilling still remains profitable.

item.title: Xi Delivers Veiled Warning to Nations Not to Take the U.S.’s Side
item.description: At an Asia-Pacific summit, the Chinese leader urged countries to “resist unilateral bullying,” an appeal that seemed at odds with his country’s recent...

item.title: How Saudi Arabia and Qatar Benefited From Rule Changes to Reach the World Cup
item.description: A soccer governing body that both countries have helped bankroll gave them extra rest and home-field advantage to set up World Cup qualification.

item.title: Executions and Mass Casualties: Videos Show Horror Unfolding in Sudan
item.description: Evidence of atrocities emerging from the city of El Fasher stoked fears that the Sudanese region of Darfur is plunging, once again, into a cycle of ge...
